title: Citizens Economic Empowerment (Transportation of Heavy and Bulk Commodities by Road) (Reservation) Regulations, 2021
content:
Supplement to the Republic of Zambia Government 137
Gazette dated Tuesday, 4th May, 2021
GOVERNMENT OF ZAMBIA
STATUTORY INSTRUMENT NO. 35 OF 2021
The Citizens Economic Empowerment Act, 2006
(Act No. 9 of 2006)
The Citizens Economic Empowerment (Transportation of
Heavy and Bulk Commodities by Road) (Reservation)
Regulations, 2021
IN EXERCISE of the powers contained in section 21 of the Citizens
Economic Empowerment Act, 2006, the following Regulations are
made:
1. These Regulations may be cited as the Citizens Economic Title
Empowerment (Transportation of Heavy and Bulk Commodities
by Road) (Reservation) Regulations, 2021.
2. In these Regulations, unless the context otherwise requires— Interpretation
“Anti-Corruption Commission” means the Anti-Corruption
Cap. 1
Commission established under the Constitution;
“authorised officer” means—
(a) a police officer;
(b) an officer of customs;
(c) an immigration officer;
(d) an officer from the Drug Enforcement Commission;
(e) an officer from the Anti-Corruption Commission;
(f) an officer from the Road Transport and Safety
Agency; or
(g) any person appointed as an authorised officer, in
writing, by the Minister;
“commodity” means a heavy and bulky commodity set out in
the Schedule;
“documentation” includes a consignment note, waybill or
manifest;
Copies of this Statutory Instrument can be obtained from the Government Printer,
P.O. Box 30136, 10101, Lusaka, Price K12.00 each
138 Statutory Instruments 4th May, 2021
“Drug Enforcement Commission” means the Drug
Enforcement Commission established under the
Cap. 1 Constitution;
“local road transporter” means a citizen empowered
company, citizen owned company, citizen influenced
company and a targeted citizen; and
“Road Transport and Safety Agency” means the Road
Act No. 11 Transport and Safety Agency established under the Road
of 2002 Traffic Act, 2002.
Transportation 3. (1) Subject to the Railways (Transportation of Heavy
of heavy and
Goods) Regulations, 2018, a person who intends to transport a
bulky
commodity commodity by road shall give preference to a local road transporter
by road
in accordance with these Regulations.
S.I. No. 7 of
2018 (2) These Regulations apply to—
(a) a producer, manufacturer or user of a raw material of a
commodity;
(b) an oil supplier;
(c) the following companies:
(i) a logistics company;
(ii) a clearing and forwarding company; and
(iii) an oil marketing company; and
(d) the transportation by road of a commodity to a person’s
plant, industry or place of business.
Export 4. A person who intends to export a commodity referred to in
transportation
the Schedule, from the Republic to another country, shall ensure
that at least fifty percent of the commodity is transported by a local
road transporter.
Domestic 5. A person who intends to transport a commodity referred to
transportation
in the Schedule within the Republic shall ensure that the commodity
is transported only by a local road transporter.
Import 6. A person who intends to import a commodity referred to in
transportation the Schedule, into the Republic, shall ensure that at least fifty percent
of the commodity is transported by a local road transporter.
Proof of 7. An authorised officer may direct a transporter of a
compliance
commodity to provide proof of compliance with these Regulations
and that transporter shall provide documentation to an authorised
officer as proof of compliance.
4th May, 2021 Statutory Instruments 139
8. (1) A person who contravenes these Regulations commits Offence
an offence and is liable, on conviction, to a fine not exceeding eight
thousand penalty units or to imprisonment for a period not exceeding
three years, or to both.
(2) Where an offence under these Regulations is committed
by a body corporate or unincorporate body, with the knowledge,
consent or connivance of the director, manager, shareholder or
partner, that director, manager, shareholder or partner of the body
corporate or unincorporate body commits an offence and is liable,
on conviction, to the penalty or term of imprisonment specified
under subregulation (1).
